intro: Platanthera peramoena f. doddsiae, commonly known as the Dodds' lady's-sock, is a rare and specialized orchid species native to the western United States. It is characterized by its delicate, pale green to yellowish flowers with a distinct, fragrant scent. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forest floors or along stream banks. It has a sympodial growth habit, with short, horizontal rhizomes and erect, leafy stems. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a threatened species requiring conservation efforts.
